author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Redhawks Fall to GCU 88-50 on Kid's Day: Highlights & Stats
text:
Redhawks Fall to GCU 88-50 on Kidâ€™s Day: Highlights & Stats
Seattle U women's basketball faced a tough defeat against Grand Canyon, losing 88-50 during Kid's Day, witnessed by 300 middle school students. Despite a strong start and a season-best performance from freshman Sydnie Rodriguez, the Redhawks were outplayed, particularly in the second and third quarters. As a result, the team remains winless in the WAC with a 0-7 record.
- Sydnie Rodriguez scored a season-high 13 points, including three three-pointers.
- Seattle U shot 30.6% from the floor compared to GCU's 54.7%.
- Redhawks started strong, leading 9-6 early but fell behind by 25 points at halftime.
- Despite a brief resurgence, GCU's scoring surge sealed the game for the Lopes.
Seattle U will have a break over the weekend before heading to Texas to face Tarleton State and UT Arlington next week. This road trip will be crucial for the team to try and secure their first WAC win.
Bottom LineThe Redhawks need to build consistency and capitalize on their strengths to turn the season around. Their ability to convert early leads into sustained performance will be key in upcoming games.
Read more at Seattle University
